abstract: Emily Cox and Henry Rathvon sing the praises of an American poet.
snippet: Emily Cox and Henry Rathvon sing the praises of an American poet.
lead_paragraph: SECOND SUNDAY PUZZLE - The quote immortalized in today's Acrostic puzzle is a confession of sorts, and a fascinating peek into the mind of a brilliant man. Walt Whitman, nineteenth century poet and essayist, admits readily that what the American people wanted to read was the sort of thing he wanted to read himself. His 1855 collection of poems, "Leaves of Grass," was considered immoral in its day for its honest portrayal of sensuality.
